March 5, 2025

La Habra, California

Where is La Habra, California

La Habra, California is a city in the United States of America. La Habra is located in the Orange County California region. It sits at the northern edge of the county bordering cities in the Los Angles County Area.

How Did La Habra Get it's Name?

La Habra officially got it's name from Mariano Reyes Roldan a farmer who was given a land grant by the Mexican Government in the early 1800's. The area was initially named by Don Gaspar de Portol√°, a Spanish Explorer, who encountered the region when he was making his way up from San Diego into Monterey along the California coast in what would later be knonw as the portola expeditiond.

What Does La Habra Mean>

The name "La Habra" means "the opening" or "the pass through the hills" in Spanish. This is in refrence to the mountainous geography surrounding it and to it's position between Chino Hills & Puente Hills as a valley between them.

La Habra As A City

La Habra began as a city of 3,000 people in 1925 and has grown to a population of about ~62,000 as of 2024.

La Habra Economy

In it's early years La Habra greatly benefited from being fertile with citrus fruit and avocados making it one of the most producing regions in the world. Today the city has a diverse economy with a huge service sector. Currently the largest employers in La Habra are Walmart & CVS.

Richard Nixon A La Habra Local

La Habra is also knonw for being home to Americas 37th President, Richard Milhous Nixon. In 1938 Richard Nixon opened up his first law office located in the center of La Habra Blvd. While the building was torn down in 1992 due to sturcutral and saftey reasons a plaque remains where the building stood honoring the legacy.
